CARDINAL . At the material time , the relevant provisions governing the arrest and detention of aliens with a view to their expulsion and remedies against such arrest and detention were contained in LAW ( Fremdengesetz DATE ) , which entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL governed detention with a view to expulsion . In so far as relevant , it provided :

“ ( CARDINAL ) An alien may be arrested and detained ( detention with a view to expulsion ) where this is necessary in order to secure the conduct of the procedure for issuing an exclusion order or an expulsion order until it becomes enforceable , or in order to secure his or her expulsion , removal or transit . ...
( CARDINAL ) Detention with a view to expulsion shall be based on an order . ...
( CARDINAL ) The decision to detain a person with a view to his or her expulsion shall be amenable to appeal under LAW . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL concerned the arrest of aliens . In so far as relevant , it provided :
“ ( CARDINAL ) The law - enforcement agencies shall be empowered to arrest an alien :
CARDINAL . NORP who is apprehended within DATE of entering the country , if he or she has entered the country by circumventing the border controls . ... ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL dealt with less intrusive measures :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The authorities may refrain from detaining a person with a view to his or her expulsion if they have reason to believe that the same purpose can be achieved by means of less stringent measures . ...

( CARDINAL ) Less stringent measures shall take the form in particular of an order to reside in accommodation designated by the authorities . Less stringent measures shall be implemented only if the alien concerned agrees to the collection of personal identification data , ...

( CARDINAL ) Following collection of his or her personal identification data , the alien concerned shall reside in the accommodation designated by the authorities and shall report DATE to a police station designated for the purpose . ... ”

CARDINAL . The provisions referred to in the CARDINAL information sheets ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) were the relevant provisions of LAW DATE , which was in force prior to DATE . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) concerned the arrest of aliens who had been apprehended within DATE of circumventing border controls , and section CARDINAL concerned detention with a view to expulsion .

“ ( CARDINAL ) Persons arrested under section CARDINAL or who have been or are being detained on the basis of LAW , shall have the right to apply to ORG alleging the unlawful nature of the order for their detention with a view to expulsion , or of their arrest or detention . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Act , in so far as relevant , provided :
